text:
HPI:
   89F transfereed from OSH with a diagnosis of free air on CT scan in the
   setting of abdominal pain.  She states she has had off and on abdominal
   pain for the past week and was seen at [**Hospital3 **] 2 days prior to
   admisison where she was found to have mild cardiac enzyme elevation,
   and she was admitted there for the past few days.  She was also having
   abdominal discomfort, all over but focused in the RLQ, and had a CT
   scan that she states was normal.  She was admitted for cardiac work-up,
   which was essentially negativem and discharged home this morning
   feeling well.  When she got home at 11am however, she noticed a severe
   increase in her RLQ pain that became much more diffuse, [**9-30**], pain
   with any movement, nausea, no vomiting.  No fevers, +chills.  She
   returned to [**Hospital3 **] where at CT scan showed a significant amount of
   free air and extravasation of contrast in ther RLQ.
   Chief complaint:
   Abdominal pain
   PMHx:
   PMH: PVD - non-healing L 3rd toe ulcer, 1v runoff (peroneal)
   HTN Hypercholesterolemia bronchitis arthritis glaucoma anxiety
   chronic back pain  LT [**Name (NI) 10168**] PTA on [**2179-3-22**]
   .
   PSH:  remote appy, multiple [**Name (NI) **] PTA/stents
   .
   Pulmonary edema
   Assessment:
   Patient rhonchi throughout lung fields  suctioning thick tan secretions
   Action:
   Patient ventilator settings  weaned from 5/ 10 to [**4-28**]
   Response:
   Patient tolerating new settings most of shift
   Plan:
   Continue with current plan of care notify team of any changes provide
   comfort and support as needed.
   .H/O abdominal pain (including abdominal tenderness)
   Assessment:
   Patient vented and sedated abd soft tolerating tube feeding at goal
   though nasal jejunal tube. Heart rate 70-80
s no ectopy in 1^st degree
   block systolic b/p 120
s-140
s over 50
s jp to bulb suction abd
   incision left open to air foley patent draining clear yellow urine.
   Action:
   Patient stooling small to medium amounts of  loose brown stool abd soft
   + flatus TPN dc
   Response:
   Patient  condition remains unchanged
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor notify  team if condition changes provide comfort
   and support as needed.
   Family meeting to discuss ?  tracheostomy  family will make decision
   tomorrow.
